extendedInfo.description: The Alberta Health Services Emergency Medical Services Medical Control Protocols for Android gives you immediate access to easy-to-use Alberta Health Services Protocols for the pre-hospital care practitioner. This information, for Alberta's medical professionals, includes all adult and pediatric algorithms as well as reference material and pharmacology necessary for the pre-hospital care practitioner. It includes more than 100 protocols and 50 medications, including infusion charts, resource information, and provincial contacts. The information contained in the AHS EMS Medical Control Protocols App is intended for the use by emergency medical practioners in the province of Alberta governed by Alberta Health Services. The main features include: (*) Quick navigation to critical information (*) Search capability (*) Portrait and landscape viewing (*) No subscription required (*) Easy to update to the most current version of the AHS EMS Medical Control Protocols Disclaimer and Copyright: The Alberta Health Services (AHS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS) is committed to providing high quality and safe patient care. To this end, AHS EMS has developed this set of Medical Control Protocols (MCPs). The MCPs contain evidence-based and expert-informed care and treatment information that is specifically intended for the use of practitioners working for AHS EMS and contracted service providers in Alberta and the physicians who provide medical oversight for these practitioners. EMS reserves the right at its own discretion to make changes, including the correction of errors and complete revisions to the MCPs. At the same time, the information is presented âas isâ and its use by external organizations or individuals is solely at their own risk. AHS EMS, its employees and physicians accepts no responsibility for any modification or redistribution or use of the MCPs and is not liable for any actions taken by individuals based on the information provided, or for any inaccuracies, errors or omissions in these MCPs. Â© 2011 Alberta Health Services. All rights reserved in relation to these MCPs. Without limiting the reservation of copyright, no person shall reproduce, store in a retrieval system or transmit in any form or by any means (electronic, mechanical, photocopying, recording or otherwise) part or the whole of these MCPs without the prior written permission of Alberta Health Services.

reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.comment: Could use categorization in addition to full alphabetical listing.  Tourniquet information links are broken. Needs search feature for devices without hardware search button. Needs an update, very sub-par.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Epic Update Fail!
reviews.comment: After the last update I cant ever open it anymore! I thought updates were suppose to fix bugs! Back to iPhone for me.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: Great app for Alberta health services!!! Any AHS employee should have considering to pertains to our protocols!!! Useless to any non-AHS EMS worker.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Won\'t open
reviews.comment: Since the last update I can\'t open the app, even after multiple uninstalls and reinstalls. Back to the pocket book :(
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Average
reviews.comment: Alright The format works alright, but appears very crudely designed. Some of the protocol titles are poorly thought out: Chest pain under Suspected AC
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Working again
reviews.comment: Works and updates perfectly again since android software update
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: It works
reviews.comment: About time the android version came out. Better late than never
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Was great...
reviews.comment: Recently had an update, now nothing works. All protocols come up as question marks... Guess its back to stickers and orange books for me :(
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Since update...
reviews.comment: ... The app doesn\'t work. C\'mon AHS.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment: **NEEDS TO BE UPDATED AS OUR PROTOCOLS UPDATE! !!**  Works well. Have used it a few times now....useful.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: @ Erik Miller
reviews.comment: Lol, get a grip! One, they\'ve changed and two, protocols are different everywhere you go beit ACLS standards or not!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Doesn\'t match ACLS
reviews.comment: Protocols diverge from ACLS standards. Unacceptable.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Fix it
reviews.comment: Won\'t open on HTC Raider. Fix it.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Keep having to reinstall.
reviews.comment: Keep having to reinstall as protocols stop showing. This is becoming a real problem. I need my protocols available to me when I\'m on a call. When the protocol us blank that could mean delayed care to my patient and that is  unacceptable. Pls fix!!
reviews.author: nathalie zacher
